intro: Guatteria crassipetala, commonly known as the thick-leaved guatteria, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its dense, leathery foliage. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by edible, orange-red berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
